channel.title: CVE Feed for advplyr -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for advplyr -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-47619|2024-08-02T21:09:37.489Z -- advplyr -- audiobookshelf
item.description: Audiobookshelf is a self-hosted audiobook and podcast server. In versions 2.4.3 and prior, users with the update permission are able to read arbitrary files, delete arbitrary files and send a GET request to arbitrary URLs and read the response. This issue may lead to Information Disclosure. As of time of publication, no patches are available.

item.title: CVE-2023-47624|2024-08-02T21:16:42.103Z -- advplyr -- audiobookshelf
item.description: Audiobookshelf is a self-hosted audiobook and podcast server. In versions 2.4.3 and prior, any user (regardless of their permissions) may be able to read files from the local file system due to a path traversal in the `/hls` endpoint. This issue may lead to Information Disclosure. As of time of publication, no patches are available.

item.title: CVE-2024-35236|2024-07-24T15:22:30.443Z -- advplyr -- audiobookshelf
item.description: Audiobookshelf is a self-hosted audiobook and podcast server. Prior to version 2.10.0, opening an ebook with malicious scripts inside leads to code execution inside the browsing context. Attacking a user with high privileges (upload, creation of libraries) can lead to remote code execution (RCE) in the worst case. This was tested on version 2.9.0 on Windows, but an arbitrary file write is powerful enough as is and should easily lead to RCE on Linux, too. Version 2.10.0 contains a patch for the vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2024-35236|2024-05-27T17:03:46.175Z -- advplyr -- audiobookshelf
item.description: Audiobookshelf is a self-hosted audiobook and podcast server. This was tested on version 2.9.0 on Windows, but an arbitrary file write is powerful enough as is and should easily lead to RCE on Linux, too. Version 2.10.0 contains a patch for the vulnerability.
